intro: Macleania pubiflora, commonly known as the woolly macleania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to the cloud forests of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage, which gives it its common name. Its flowers are small and typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the base of the stems. Macleania pubiflora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to adapt to various growing conditions.
